title: Senate votes to send tech exec David Cohen to Ottawa as Biden’s U.S. envoy
Ontario will unveil its plan for COVID-19 booster shots on Wednesday
summary: Ontario will unveil its plan for more COVID-19 booster shots Wednesday, clearing the way for AstraZeneca recipients and others to get top-ups as the province continues efforts to get more first and second doses into arms.

title: No ‘euthanasia’ in Quebec care homes during COVID-19, expert tells coroner’s inquest
A look at minimum wage rates across Canadian provinces and territories
Heather Scoffield: Can Justin Trudeau spread Canada’s carbon price and help save the world?
summary: Justin Trudeau has decided to make his mark on the world by trying to take Canada’s controversial carbon tax global. It’s an intriguing idea, Heather Scoffield writes.

title: PM says Indigenous talks may offer ‘solution’ so Canada can honour war dead
Kabul safe houses need $5 million by Friday to stay open, say veterans
Ex-soldier who killed his family in N.S. knew what he did was morally wrong: doctor
As trade bottlenecks weigh on economy, Liberals urged to help reshape supply chains
B.C. Premier John Horgan working virtually after throat biopsy
Progressive Conservative Leader Heather Stefanson sworn in as Manitoba’s new premier
Flanked by union leaders, Doug Ford raises Ontario’s minimum wage to $15 an hour
summary: Premier Doug Ford’s surprise pre-election boost of the minimum wage to $15-an-hour — three years after he scrapped a scheduled increase and during a pandemic that has roiled businesses — is jolting the political and labour landscape.

title: Experts worried about extent of damage to N.L. health system following cyberattack
summary: Cybersecurity experts say the data centre for Newfoundland and Labrador’s health-care system was targeted, leading to the cancellation of thousands of medical appointments.

title: Quebec to permit dancing, karaoke again as COVID-19 restrictions loosened
Ontario to boost minimum wage to $15 an hour, Ford says
Elections Canada probed how many Canadians have a ‘conspiracy mindset’
B.C. announces plans to defer old-growth logging across 26,000 square kilometres
Trudeau takes carbon pricing debate to the global stage at COP26
‘All the students are drained’: Ontario boards want Stephen Lecce to end modified semesters at high schools
summary: Ontario school boards are asking the province to move back to a normal semester for high school students in the new year, saying the current “modified” model is not working for teens — or teachers.

title: Martin Regg Cohn: Mohamad Fakih and Walied Soliman made legal history. Now it’s harder for haters to have their way
summary: Mohamad Fakih and Walied Soliman were personally harangued and persecuted for no reason beyond their faith, they were publicly vilified and personally victimized. Yet both refused to play victim and today, each is victorious, Martin Regg Cohn writes.
